properties.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt; Mendocino Coast; Coastal Del Norte
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 30 at 1:01PM PST until January 30 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...A westerly swell will result in both large breaking
waves of 17 to 20 feet and an enhanced threat of sneaker waves
on area beaches.

* WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Humboldt, and Mendocino Counties.

* WHEN...Through this evening.

* IMPACTS...Building surf and potentially sneaker waves may
create locally hazardous conditions on area beaches today.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A sneaker wave is a wave that washes
unexpectedly far up the beach, often after a long period of
much smaller waves before it. Sneaker waves can easily catch
people off guard, and are very dangerous and often deadly due
to the cold, turbulent ocean waters.
properties.instruction:
Maintain a safe distance from the surf, and always keep your eye
on the ocean. Also, remain out of the water to avoid hazardous
swimming conditions, and avoid walking on rocks or jettys.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM THIS EVENING
